Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can illustrate a healthy plant that has received enough water, depicting features like bright green leaves.
The student can illustrate a plant that shows signs of not having enough water by including elements like wilting or browning leaves.
The student can show a comparison between a healthy plant and a plant lacking water with both plants drawn side by side.
The student can use their drawing to describe, with some detail, how a lack of water affects plants, such as noting drooped stems or dull color.
CANNOT: The student may not consistently use patterns in their drawing to demonstrate that plants need water to live and grow (e.g., the student might not clearly depict growth stages).
The student might incorrectly label parts of the plant due to oversight (e.g., forgetting to label roots) or depict water as less essential when comparing other growth factors.
